meanings.sent1: She gripped the handle of the door and pulled it open.
meanings.sent2: He gripped the rope tightly as he climbed the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The kitten gripped the toy mouse with its tiny paws, thinking it was real.

meanings.definition: To have a strong effect on
meanings.sent1: The emotional movie gripped the audience, making them cry.
meanings.sent2: The thrilling novel gripped her attention until the very end.
meanings.sent3: Laughter gripped the room as the comedian told his jokes.
meanings.sent4: Anxiety gripped her mind, making it hard to focus on anything else.
meanings.sent5: Curiosity gripped the children as they peeked into the mysterious old house.
